text: where there's all that snot snot is
really just a form of mucus mucus is a
slimy secretion produced by the mucus
membranes which line all external
cavities of the body exposed to the
outside environment or that were exposed
when we were wild and naked the point of
mucus is to lubricate and protect these
parts of the body it's jobs range from
trapping airborne pollutants to helping
you have a poo a typical person produces
about a liter of mucus of all types
every day so your respiratory system the
business of breathing is protected by a
special type of mucus called phlegm its
job is to protect the lungs from nasty
things that might otherwise get in there
these include dust pollen smoke and the
soot from badly maintained diesel
engines the stuff that makes it to your
nose is called nasal mucus or snot mucus
is sticky so it works a little bit like
liquid flypaper trapping nasty stuff and
washing it away the work it must flow
continuously with a gentle rinsing
action
most of the stuff it traps ends up being
swallowed and destroyed by the acids in
your stomach but some of it is thrown
out by coughing and sneezing you
actually produce snot constantly but not
very much
so it tends to dry up in your nose and
form bogeys for Gilberts or boogers
depending on where you're from
these can be blamed or if you're under
16 mind with a little finger and left
under the seat in a seminar classroom
however some illnesses especially the
common cold and influenza stimulate
increased production of phlegm and snot
because your lungs are crying out for
better protection so the snot in your
nose can't drive out to form a few Jolly
Green Giants in the normal way
it runs straight ahead at the end of
your nose this is called hypersecretion
the problem is made worse in winter
because low temperatures caused
something called the cilia cells to stop
working normally they sweep mucus away
from your nostrils so when they pack up
your nose runs this is why a cold is
called a college your snot will change
color if you become infected this is

passes that your body is trying to expel
